dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, we have some really significant news coming out, uh, regarding dark money in politics. For the very first time in the Citizens United era, a group has actually been forced to disclose its donors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, we have some really significant news coming out, uh, regarding dark money in politics. For the very first time in the Citizens United era, a group has actually been forced to disclose its donors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is the first time in the Citizens United-era that a dark money group was forced to disclose their donors in a certain time period, said Jordan Libowitz, a spokesperson for nonprofit watchdog group Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington, referring to the 2010 Supreme Court case that wiped away previous restrictions on political spending.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, this is huge! We're talking about Americans for Job Security, or AJS. They've been fighting this for years, right? Like, claiming they weren't a political organization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, this is huge! We're talking about Americans for Job Security, or A J S. They've been fighting this for years, right? Like, claiming they weren't a political organization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Americans for Job Security had previously claimed it was not a political organization and therefore did not have to disclose its donors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But after, uh, years of litigation, this watchdog group, CREW—Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington—they actually convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But after, uh, years of litigation, this watchdog group, C R E W-Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington-they actually convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But after years of litigation, CREW convinced the Federal Election Commission otherwise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And so now we finally get to see, like, who's been funding them, right? Who are these big donors?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And so now we finally get to see, like, who's been funding them, right? Who are these big donors?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And some of the names are pretty wild. The biggest individual donor appears to be, uh, Charles Schwab himself, the brokerage titan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And some of the names are pretty wild. The biggest individual donor appears to be, uh, Charles Schwab himself, the brokerage titan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The biggest individual donor to the group appears to be Charles Schwab, the brokerage titan worth an estimated $7.8 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, Charles Schwab? [overlaps] The Charles Schwab?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, Charles Schwab? The Charles Schwab?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he donated nearly nine million dollars over just three months in 2012.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he donated nearly nine million dollars over just three months in twenty twelve.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the span of three months in 2012, he donated nearly $9 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. And, uh, I heard the Gap co-founder, Doris Fisher, and her sons also gave another nine million. That's a lot of money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. And, uh, I heard the Gap co-founder, Doris Fisher, and her sons also gave another nine million. That's a lot of money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Gap cofounder Doris Fisheralong with her sons Robert, John and Williamgave another $9 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And it's not just, uh, California-based donors anymore, which is what we saw in a previous redacted list. This new FEC filing shows billionaires from all over the country.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And it's not just, uh, California-based donors anymore, which is what we saw in a previous redacted list. This new F E C filing shows billionaires from all over the country.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2013 a California state watchdog agency released a redacted donor list following an investigation conducted by the agency. That redacted list showed donors with mostly California addresses. The new FEC filing shows billionaire donors from around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, like the DeVos family, right? I saw their names mentioned.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like the DeVos family, right? I saw their names mentioned.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave $1 million to the group in October 2012.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave a million. And then you have, um, several Texas oil-and-gas billionaires listed, like Richard Kinder, Dan and Farris Wilks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave a million. And then you have, um, several Texas oil and gas billionaires listed, like Richard Kinder, Dan and Farris Wilks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The late Republican megadonors Richard and Helen DeVos gave $1 million to the group in October 2012. Texas oil-and-gas billionaires Richard Kinder, Dan Wilks, Farris Wilks and late Houston Texans owner Robert McNair were also among the donors that year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, Vince McMahon and Linda McMahon from WWE, they're on there too, which is, uh, pretty interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, Vince McMahon and Linda McMahon from W W E, they're on there too, which is, uh, pretty interesting.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: WWE chief executive Vince McMahon donated, along with his wife Linda McMahon, who Donald Trump later appointed to his cabinet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Linda, of course, went on to join Donald Trump's cabinet later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Linda, of course, went on to join Donald Trump's cabinet later.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: WWE chief executive Vince McMahon donated, along with his wife Linda McMahon, who Donald Trump later appointed to his cabinet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right! And it's not just individuals, either. Companies like Wynn Resorts and Bass Pro Shops also contributed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right! And it's not just individuals, either. Companies like Wynn Resorts and Bass Pro Shops also contributed.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies of several billionaires are also on the list, including Wynn Resorts, which was cofounded by billionaire Steve Wynn and his then-wife Elaine Wynn (Steve Wynn resigned as chairman and CEO in February 2018 and sold all his Wynn Resorts shares), and Bass Pro Shops, the sporting goods retailer founded and majority owned by billionaire John Morris.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. So, this really is, like, a landmark moment for transparency, after, uh, so many years of these groups operating completely in the dark.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. So, this really is, like, a landmark moment for transparency, after, uh, so many years of these groups operating completely in the dark.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. It, um, opens up a whole new window into who's actually influencing our politics.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. It, um, opens up a whole new window into who's actually influencing our politics.
